00030 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LQUOTA
00031 
00032 #include <linux/module.h>
00033 #include <linux/slab.h>
00034 #include <obd_class.h>
00035 #include "lquota_internal.h"
00036 
00037 static int hash_lqs_cur_bits = HASH_LQE_CUR_BITS;
00038 module_param(hash_lqs_cur_bits, int, 0444);
00039 MODULE_PARM_DESC(hash_lqs_cur_bits, "the current bits of lqe hash");
00040 
00041 static unsigned
00042 lqe64_hash_hash(struct cfs_hash *hs, const void *key, unsigned mask)
00043 {
00044         return cfs_hash_u64_hash(*((__u64 *)key), mask);
00045 }
00046 
00047 static void *lqe64_hash_key(struct hlist_node *hnode)
00048 {
00049         struct lquota_entry *lqe;
00050         lqe = hlist_entry(hnode, struct lquota_entry, lqe_hash);
00051         return &lqe->lqe_id.qid_uid;
00052 }
00053 
00054 static int lqe64_hash_keycmp(const void *key, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00055 {
00056         struct lquota_entry *lqe;
00057         lqe = hlist_entry(hnode, struct lquota_entry, lqe_hash);
00058         return (lqe->lqe_id.qid_uid == *((__u64*)key));
00059 }
00060 
00061 static void *lqe_hash_object(struct hlist_node *hnode)
00062 {
00063         return hlist_entry(hnode, struct lquota_entry, lqe_hash);
00064 }
00065 
00066 static void lqe_hash_get(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00067 {
00068         struct lquota_entry *lqe;
00069         lqe = hlist_entry(hnode, struct lquota_entry, lqe_hash);
00070         lqe_getref(lqe);
00071 }
00072 
00073 static void lqe_hash_put_locked(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00074 {
00075         struct lquota_entry *lqe;
00076         lqe = hlist_entry(hnode, struct lquota_entry, lqe_hash);
00077         lqe_putref(lqe);
00078 }
00079 
00080 static void lqe_hash_exit(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct hlist_node *hnode)
00081 {
00082         CERROR("Should not have any item left!\n");
00083 }
00084 
00085 /* lqe hash methods for 64-bit uid/gid, new hash functions would have to be
00086  * defined for per-directory quota relying on a 128-bit FID */
00087 static struct cfs_hash_ops lqe64_hash_ops = {
00088         .hs_hash       = lqe64_hash_hash,
00089         .hs_key        = lqe64_hash_key,
00090         .hs_keycmp     = lqe64_hash_keycmp,
00091         .hs_object     = lqe_hash_object,
00092         .hs_get        = lqe_hash_get,
00093         .hs_put_locked = lqe_hash_put_locked,
00094         .hs_exit       = lqe_hash_exit
00095 };
00096 
00097 /* Logging helper function */
00098 void lquota_lqe_debug0(struct lquota_entry *lqe,
00099                        struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *msgdata,
00100                        const char *fmt, ...)
00101 {
00102         struct lquota_site *site = lqe->lqe_site;
00103         va_list args;
00104 
00105         LASSERT(site->lqs_ops->lqe_debug != NULL);
00106 
00107         va_start(args, fmt);
00108         site->lqs_ops->lqe_debug(lqe, site->lqs_parent, msgdata, fmt, args);
00109         va_end(args);
00110 }
00111 
00112 struct lqe_iter_data {
00113         unsigned long   lid_inuse;
00114         unsigned long   lid_freed;
00115         bool            lid_free_all;
00116 };
00117 
00118 static int lqe_iter_cb(struct cfs_hash *hs, struct cfs_hash_bd *bd,
00119                        struct hlist_node *hnode, void *data)
00120 {
00121         struct lqe_iter_data *d = (struct lqe_iter_data *)data;
00122         struct lquota_entry  *lqe;
00123 
00124         lqe = hlist_entry(hnode, struct lquota_entry, lqe_hash);
00125         LASSERT(atomic_read(&lqe->lqe_ref) > 0);
00126 
00127         /* Only one reference held by hash table, and nobody else can
00128          * grab the entry at this moment, it's safe to remove it from
00129          * the hash and free it. */
00130         if (atomic_read(&lqe->lqe_ref) == 1) {
00131                 if (!lqe_is_master(lqe)) {
00132                         LASSERT(lqe->lqe_pending_write == 0);
00133                         LASSERT(lqe->lqe_pending_req == 0);
00134                 }
00135                 if (d->lid_free_all || lqe->lqe_enforced) {
00136                         d->lid_freed++;
00137                         cfs_hash_bd_del_locked(hs, bd, hnode);
00138                         return 0;
00139                 }
00140         }
00141         d->lid_inuse++;
00142 
00143         if (d->lid_free_all)
00144                 LQUOTA_ERROR(lqe, "Inuse quota entry");
00145         return 0;
00146 }
00147 
00155 static void lqe_cleanup(struct cfs_hash *hash, bool free_all)
00156 {
00157         struct lqe_iter_data    d;
00158         int                     repeat = 0;
00159         ENTRY;
00160 retry:
00161         memset(&d, 0, sizeof(d));
00162         d.lid_free_all = free_all;
00163 
00164         cfs_hash_for_each_safe(hash, lqe_iter_cb, &d);
00165 
00166         /* In most case, when this function is called on master or
00167          * slave finalization, there should be no inuse quota entry.
00168          *
00169          * If the per-fs quota updating thread is still holding
00170          * some entries, we just wait for it's finished. */
00171         if (free_all && d.lid_inuse) {
00172                 CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "Hash:%p has entries inuse: inuse:%lu, "
00173                         "freed:%lu, repeat:%u\n", hash,
00174                         d.lid_inuse, d.lid_freed, repeat);
00175                 repeat++;
00176                 set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
00177                 schedule_timeout(cfs_time_seconds(1));
00178                 goto retry;
00179         }
00180         EXIT;
00181 }
00182 
00183 /*
00184  * Allocate a new lquota site.
00185  *
00186  * \param env    - the environment passed by the caller
00187  * \param parent - is a pointer to the parent structure, either a qmt_pool_info
00188  *                 structure on the master or a qsd_qtype_info structure on the
00189  *                 slave.
00190  * \param is_master - is set when the site belongs to a QMT.
00191  * \param qtype     - is the quota type managed by this site
00192  * \param ops       - is the quota entry operation vector to be used for quota
00193  *                    entry belonging to this site.
00194  *
00195  * \retval 0     - success
00196  * \retval -ve   - failure
00197  */
00198 struct lquota_site *lquota_site_alloc(const struct lu_env *env, void *parent,
00199                                       bool is_master, short qtype,
00200                                       struct lquota_entry_operations *ops)
00201 {
00202         struct lquota_site      *site;
00203         char                     hashname[15];
00204         ENTRY;
00205 
00206         LASSERT(qtype < MAXQUOTAS);
00207 
00208         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(site);
00209         if (site == NULL)
00210                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00211 
00212         /* assign parameters */
00213         site->lqs_qtype  = qtype;
00214         site->lqs_parent = parent;
00215         site->lqs_is_mst = is_master;
00216         site->lqs_ops    = ops;
00217 
00218         /* allocate hash table */
00219         memset(hashname, 0, sizeof(hashname));
00220         snprintf(hashname, sizeof(hashname), "LQUOTA_HASH%hu", qtype);
00221         site->lqs_hash= cfs_hash_create(hashname, hash_lqs_cur_bits,
00222                                         HASH_LQE_MAX_BITS,
00223                                         min(hash_lqs_cur_bits,
00224                                             HASH_LQE_BKT_BITS),
00225                                         0, CFS_HASH_MIN_THETA,
00226                                         CFS_HASH_MAX_THETA, &lqe64_hash_ops,
00227                                         CFS_HASH_DEFAULT|CFS_HASH_BIGNAME);
00228         if (site->lqs_hash == NULL) {
00229                 OBD_FREE_PTR(site);
00230                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00231         }
00232 
00233         RETURN(site);
00234 }
00235 
00236 /*
00237  * Destroy a lquota site.
00238  *
00239  * \param env  - the environment passed by the caller
00240  * \param site - lquota site to be destroyed
00241  *
00242  * \retval 0     - success
00243  * \retval -ve   - failure
00244  */
00245 void lquota_site_free(const struct lu_env *env, struct lquota_site *site)
00246 {
00247         /* cleanup hash table */
00248         lqe_cleanup(site->lqs_hash, true);
00249         cfs_hash_putref(site->lqs_hash);
00250 
00251         site->lqs_parent = NULL;
00252         OBD_FREE_PTR(site);
00253 }
00254 
00255 /*
00256  * Initialize qsd/qmt-specific fields of quota entry.
00257  *
00258  * \param lqe - is the quota entry to initialize
00259  */
00260 static void lqe_init(struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00261 {
00262         struct lquota_site *site;
00263         ENTRY;
00264 
00265         LASSERT(lqe != NULL);
00266         site = lqe->lqe_site;
00267         LASSERT(site != NULL);
00268         LASSERT(site->lqs_ops->lqe_init != NULL);
00269 
00270         LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "init");
00271 
00272         site->lqs_ops->lqe_init(lqe, site->lqs_parent);
00273 }
00274 
00275 /*
00276  * Update a lquota entry. This is done by reading quota settings from the
00277  * on-disk index. The lquota entry must be write locked.
00278  *
00279  * \param env - the environment passed by the caller
00280  * \param lqe - is the quota entry to refresh
00281  */
00282 static int lqe_read(const struct lu_env *env, struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00283 {
00284         struct lquota_site      *site;
00285         int                      rc;
00286         ENTRY;
00287 
00288         LASSERT(lqe != NULL);
00289         site = lqe->lqe_site;
00290         LASSERT(site != NULL);
00291         LASSERT(site->lqs_ops->lqe_read != NULL);
00292 
00293         LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "read");
00294 
00295         rc = site->lqs_ops->lqe_read(env, lqe, site->lqs_parent);
00296         if (rc == 0)
00297                 /* mark the entry as up-to-date */
00298                 lqe->lqe_uptodate = true;
00299 
00300         RETURN(rc);
00301 }
00302 
00303 /*
00304  * Find or create a quota entry.
00305  *
00306  * \param env  - the environment passed by the caller
00307  * \param site - lquota site which stores quota entries in a hash table
00308  * \param qid  - is the quota ID to be found/created
00309  *
00310  * \retval 0     - success
00311  * \retval -ve   - failure
00312  */
00313 struct lquota_entry *lqe_locate(const struct lu_env *env,
00314                                 struct lquota_site *site, union lquota_id *qid)
00315 {
00316         struct lquota_entry     *lqe, *new = NULL;
00317         int                      rc = 0;
00318         ENTRY;
00319 
00320         lqe = cfs_hash_lookup(site->lqs_hash, (void *)&qid->qid_uid);
00321         if (lqe != NULL) {
00322                 LASSERT(lqe->lqe_uptodate);
00323                 RETURN(lqe);
00324         }
00325 
00326         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(new, lqe_kmem, GFP_NOFS);
00327         if (new == NULL) {
00328                 CERROR("Fail to allocate lqe for id:"LPU64", "
00329                         "hash:%s\n", qid->qid_uid, site->lqs_hash->hs_name);
00330                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00331         }
00332 
00333         atomic_set(&new->lqe_ref, 1); /* hold 1 for caller */
00334         new->lqe_id     = *qid;
00335         new->lqe_site   = site;
00336         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&new->lqe_link);
00337 
00338         /* quota settings need to be updated from disk, that's why
00339          * lqe->lqe_uptodate isn't set yet */
00340         new->lqe_uptodate = false;
00341 
00342         /* perform qmt/qsd specific initialization */
00343         lqe_init(new);
00344 
00345         /* read quota settings from disk and mark lqe as up-to-date */
00346         rc = lqe_read(env, new);
00347         if (rc)
00348                 GOTO(out, lqe = ERR_PTR(rc));
00349 
00350         /* add new entry to hash */
00351         lqe = cfs_hash_findadd_unique(site->lqs_hash, &new->lqe_id.qid_uid,
00352                                       &new->lqe_hash);
00353         if (lqe == new)
00354                 new = NULL;
00355 out:
00356         if (new)
00357                 lqe_putref(new);
00358         RETURN(lqe);
00359 }
